com.colex.taglang

Class Lexicon

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.colex.taglang.Lexicon

  • public class Lexicon
extends java.lang.Object
    A lexicon object is an object that contains a link to a file that contains a word list, Each word in the list is tagged. The object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Lexicon(java.io.File f)
      Constructor constructs a Lexicon object from a file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Lexicon

        public Lexicon(java.io.File f)
        Constructor constructs a Lexicon object from a file. The Lexicon object is associated with this file. The file is required to access the list of words.
        Parameters:
        f -

      • findTags

        public final int[] findTags(Tag[] tags)
        Finds the index of various tags
        Parameters:
        tags -
        Returns:
        an array of integer of length equal to than of the @param tag, each element of the array is an index of the corresponding tag, or -1 if the tag doesn't exist

      • findTag

        public final boolean findTag(Tag tg)
        Finds a tag
        Returns:
        true if the tag is found and false otherwise.

      • addWord

        public final void addWord(java.lang.String word,
                          Tag[] tags)
        Adds a word to the lexicon along with a sequence of tags associated with it. All tags are assumed to be of type default, even if they are otherwise.
        Parameters:
        word - The new word to add to the lexicon
        tags - The array of tags associated with the tags

      • addWord

        public final void addWord(java.lang.String word,
                          Tag[] tags,
                          boolean checkDuplicates)
        Adds a word to a lexicon along with a sequence of tags associated with it. All tags are assumed to be of type default, even if they are otherwise.
        Parameters:
        word - The new word to add to the lexicon
        tags - The array of tags associated with the word
        checkDuplicates -

      • addWord

                          Tag[] tags,
                          boolean checkTagDuplicates,
                          boolean checkWordDuplicates)
        Adds a word to the lexicon along with a sequence of tags associated with it. All tags are assumed to be of type default, even if they are otherwise.
        Parameters:
        word - The new word to add to the lexicon
        tags - The array of tags associated with the word
        checkTagDuplicates -
        checkWordDuplicates -

      • findWord

        public final int findWord(java.lang.String word)
        Finds a word in the lexicon and returns the index of the word found. The word tags can later be accessed by getWordTags.
        Parameters:
        word - the word to search for.
        Returns:
        the index of the word found, -1 if word isn't found.

      • getWordTags

        public final Tag[] getWordTags()
        Returns the tags of the most recently accessed word in the lexicon
        Returns:
        The list of tags

      • findWordTags

        public final Tag[] findWordTags(java.lang.String word)
        Finds a word and returns the list of tags associated with the word
        Parameters:
        word -
        Returns:
        List of tags, if word is found. null otherwise.

      • wordCount

        public final int wordCount()
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Finds the number of words in the lexicon.
        Returns:
        the number of words in the lexicon
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the lexicon file can't be found

      • setWordFile

        public final void setWordFile(java.io.File wordFile)
                       throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Changes the word file used for the lexicon.
        Parameters:
        wordFile -
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the lexicon file cannot be found.

      • hasMagic

        public final boolean hasMagic()
        Test whether or not the file has a valid magic number. The magic number is 54 4c 00.
        Returns:
        true if the magic number is valid, false otherwise
